issue.title: filesystem::canonical() still defined in terms of absolute(p, base)

discussion.p:
This is from editorial issue #1620:
Since the resolution of US-78 was applied (as part of P0492R2), std::filesystem::absolute(path, base) no longer exists. However, std::filesystem::canonical is still defined in terms of absolute(p, base).
discussion.note: 2017-06-27 P1 after 5 positive votes on c++std-lib
discussion.p: Davis Herring: This needs to be P1 — due to a wording gap in P0492R2, 2 out of the 3 overloads of filesystem::canonical() have bad signatures and are unimplementable.
